channel.title: Cachedownloader
channel.description:
Hey i have the torvapkz client and source and i am having problems with the cache downloader. Here are my errors, i'm not sure if there is an antileech? or just something simple, i do not know. And BEFORE YOU SAY MAP.CONFIG IS IN THE WRONG PLACE it is not.
[img]http://www.upload.ee/image/3553946/cashfail.png[/img]
edit: got to 100% by re-downloading here are the errors that make no sense to me. [img]http://www.upload.ee/image/3553955/cashfail.png[/img]

item.title: Cachedownloader
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:

Also, check cachedownloader.java

And make sure your dropbox link is

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

pabb:

so what you are saying is i go to my cache folder, make a winrar archive and then drop all the files into it?

Yerp

Read full topic

item.title: Cachedownloader
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

No no. how I do it is:
I go into the cache folder (where all the main_file_cache’s are and that jazz) I right click and (I have win rar) and click Create new winrar zip archive. Then I title it the name of my cache (Like sk8rscapecache for example), and then I select all files in that folder (use CTRL+A) and deselect the zip archive I just made (Ctrl+click the zip) and drag it till it says “Add to… zip name” and add it
then I upload that folder.
if that makes sense

Read full topic

item.title: Cachedownloader
item.dc:creator: @pabb pabb
item.description:
@pabb wrote:

However, it does that everytime (i’ve redownloaded the cache like 5 times). So before i upload my cache to dropbox, your basically telling me to zip the whole folder? because i was zipping the insides, thanks for being helpful btw.

Read full topic

item.title: Cachedownloader
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

pabb:

when i open it firstly it has ErazedPkzcache1 in a zip file and then the others inside

Exactly. Zip
That means it download and didn’t extract properly. Sounds like the cache was packed wrong.
Manually unzip the content of the zip into that folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Cachedownloader
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Open My Computer.
Open the C:\ Drive
Find the folder ErasedPkzcache1 and open it
Open maps folder
is there a file called mapConfig.txt in there?
then go back and open the Data folder
Then open the Animation folder
is there a file called flo.dat in there?

Read full topic
